publicwhip.spmotion: *S3M-3094 Pauline McNeill: Scotland at Ten—That the Parliament regrets BBC Scotland’s decision to stop producing Scotland at Ten in its current format; expresses concern that the new format represents a lowering of standards in relation to current affairs production as there will not be live discussion in the new format; believes that Scotland at Ten has been an important feature of current affairs in Scotland for Scots who want to be more informed about Scottish politics and Scottish affairs, and urges BBC Scotland to reconsider its decision. Supported by: John Wilson*, Margaret Curran*, James Kelly*, Robert Brown*, Alex Neil*, Hugh O’Donnell*, Lewis Macdonald*, Ken Macintosh*, Kenneth Gibson*, Patrick Harvie*, Robin Harper*, Trish Godman*
